what: Set of Tools for Ecological Interaction Geospatial Analysis
title: Set of Tools for Ecological Interaction Geospatial Analysis
text: ecointeraction package. main goal provide tools model potential interactions given known interactions predict unknown interactions based, limited, phylogenetic, environmental geographic distance among host.

title: Set of Tools for Ecological Interaction Geospatial Analysis
text: can install development version ecointeraction GitHub :

title: Set of Tools for Ecological Interaction Geospatial Analysis
text: explore raw data base mammal virus. use function accumulate_incidence get many reported cases host species. use information create datasets train. print frist 6 head. use cutoff_incidence function keet just portion host information system.
code: mammal_flavivirus_incidence <- accumulate_incidence(data = mammalvirus,                                                     group = mammal_species,                                                     incidence = incidence) flavivirus_host <- cutoff_incidence(mammal_flavivirus_incidence)

title: Set of Tools for Ecological Interaction Geospatial Analysis
text: Now can prepare dataset modelling using distance table. provide distance table calculated befare using mean distance one target host host. show full pipeline using count table plasmodium reported host species. use accumulate_incidence function cuttoff_incidence keep host information. use prep_incidence_data prepare data modelling using birdsdistance dataset provide print fifteen first rows
code: plasmodium_data <- birdsplasmodium %>%      accumulate_incidence(group = species) %>%      cutoff_incidence() %>%      prep_incidence_data(distance  = birdsdistance)  #> Joining, by = c("species", "geo_distance", "env_distance", "phylo_distance") models <- automodel_replication(plasmodium_data, birdsdistance) #> [2022-09-06 10:54:02] Training of 'Ranger' started. #> Loading required package: ggplot2 #> Loading required package: lattice #> [2022-09-06 10:54:36] Training of 'Ranger' completed. models$roc #> # A tibble: 1 x 3 #>   .metric .estimator .estimate #>   <chr>   <chr>          <dbl> #> 1 roc_auc binary         0.911

code: library(ecointeraction) accumulate_incidence(mammalvirus, virus, incidence) #> # A tibble: 19 × 4 #>       id virus incidence cummulativesum #>    <int> <chr>     <dbl>          <dbl> #>  1     1 WNV        1712           1712 #>  2     2 SLEV        759           2471 #>  3     3 JEV         448           2919 #>  4     4 DENV        413           3332 #>  5     5 YFV         319           3651 #>  6     6 WSLV        257           3908 #>  7     7 ZIKV        240           4148 #>  8     8 POTV        178           4326 #>  9     9 ILHV        145           4471 #> 10    10 NTAV         77           4548 #> 11    11 SPOV         71           4619 #> 12    12 BSQV         21           4640 #> 13    13 USUV         18           4658 #> 14    14 BANV         13           4671 #> 15    15 ROCV         12           4683 #> 16    16 UGSV          2           4685 #> 17    17 TMUV          1           4686 #> 18    18 CAPV          0           4686 #> 19    19 SABV          0           4686

what: batsdistance A dataset containing the median phylogenetic, geographical and enviromental distances of bats. The raw-data has the distances for each pair of bats. The data was centered and scaled. Then was summarized by each species taking the median for each distance. Environmental information from WorldClim project Phylogenetic information from Vertlife project Geografical information from GBIF project — batsdistance

what: prep_incidence_data Function to prepare incidence data with distance data to model. Takes the species in the incidence data and join with a sample form the distance data. This allow to get a dataset ready to model with ML framework — prep_incidence_data
title: prep_incidence_data Function to prepare incidence data with distance data to model. Takes the species in the incidence data and join with a sample form the distance data. This allow to get a dataset ready to model with ML framework — prep_incidence_data

title: prep_incidence_data Function to prepare incidence data with distance data to model. Takes the species in the incidence data and join with a sample form the distance data. This allow to get a dataset ready to model with ML framework — prep_incidence_data
code: library(ecointeraction) birdsplasmodium %>%     accumulate_incidence(group = species) %>%     cutoff_incidence() %>%     prep_incidence_data(distance  = birdsdistance) #> Joining with `by = join_by(species, geo_distance, env_distance, #> phylo_distance)` #> # A tibble: 141 × 5 #>    species                geo_distance env_distance phylo_distance incidence   #>    <chr>                         <dbl>        <dbl>          <dbl> <fct>       #>  1 Psarocolius cassini          0.178        -0.144         -0.291 unknown     #>  2 Conioptilon mcilhennyi       0.0552       -0.528         -0.291 unknown     #>  3 Haliaeetus sanfordi          0.626         1.97           0.443 unknown     #>  4 Prinia fluviatilis          -0.0505        0.109         -0.291 unknown     #>  5 Rukia longirostra            0.624         3.14          -0.291 unknown     #>  6 Turdus merula                0.0419        0.395         -0.291 susceptible #>  7 Coturnicops notatus         -0.164        -0.590          0.478 unknown     #>  8 Contopus sordidulus          0.134         0.216         -0.291 unknown     #>  9 Atlapetes albinucha          0.151        -0.581         -0.291 unknown     #> 10 Ninox punctulata             0.271        -0.120          0.443 unknown     #> # ℹ 131 more rows

what: rodent_distance_raw A data set containing the phylogenetic geometric mean, median geographical distance and most probable environmental distances of rodents. Environmental information from WorldClim project (PCA of bio layers) The raw-data has the distances for each pair of rodents. Phylogenetic information from Nathan Upham project, Geografical information from UICN project. — rodent_distance_raw
title: rodent_distance_raw A data set containing the phylogenetic geometric mean, median geographical distance and most probable environmental distances of rodents.
